marketNews.title: Gaikindo revises 2024 national car wholesale sales target down to 850,000 units
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Automotive Industry Association (Gaikindo), Jongkie Sugiarto, said that the association has revised down the 2024 national car wholesale sales target from 1.1 million units to 850,000 units. The new target is 15.5% lower than the 2023 wholesale sales realization of 1 million units. The revision is based on the 9M24 wholesale sales realization, which fell 16.2% year‑on‑year to 633,218 units. According to the new target, the 9M24 realization has reached 74.5% of the target.

marketNews.title: Foreign Minister Sugiono outlines Indonesia's aim to join BRICS and upcoming G20 participation
marketNews.content: Foreign Minister Sugiono said that Indonesia wants to join the BRICS group. He described BRICS, led by Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa, as the "right vehicle" to advance the interests of developing countries and stated that Indonesia's accession to BRICS reflects an active and independent foreign policy. The statement came after Indonesia officially became a partner (not a full member) of BRICS on Thursday, 24 October 2024. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto said Indonesia will continue to engage with other multilateral groups. In the near future, President Prabowo will attend the G20 summit in Brazil in November 2024, and Indonesia is also undergoing the accession process to become a member of the OECD.

marketNews.title: BRICS members agree to use local currencies in transactions
marketNews.content: The BRICS member countries agreed to use local currencies in financial transactions among members and partner countries, according to the announcement of the 16th BRICS summit held from 22 to 24 October 2024. Previously, Russian President Vladimir Putin called for an alternative international payment system on Tuesday, 22 October, to prevent the United States from using the US dollar as a political weapon.

marketNews.title: BPK finds flawed food commodity data causing price spikes
marketNews.content: The State Audit Board (BPK) discovered that the calculations of production and needs for strategic food commodities performed by the National Food Agency (Bapanas) did not use valid and up‑to‑date data, leading to a surge in food commodity prices in the first half of 2024. Consequently, BPK stated that the food balance projections from Bapanas and the commodity balance for rice, corn, soybeans, onions, chilies, sugar, beef, poultry and eggs in the National Commodity Balance System cannot be used as a basis for decision‑making and policy formulation aimed at stabilising national food supply and prices, including import policies.

marketNews.title: Keramik association forecasts demand from 3‑million‑house program
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Association, Edy Suyanto, said that the government's program of building 3 million houses per year, announced by President Prabowo Subianto, could add about 100 million square meters of new ceramic demand annually. This amount equals 16% of the current total industry capacity of 625 million square meters. Edy noted that the program could raise the utilization of the national ceramic industry from 64% in October 2024 to 85% in 2024 and 95% in 2026. As utilization approaches full capacity by 2026, the industry will need to add 75 million square meters of installed capacity, or roughly IDR 20 trillion, by 2027. The estimated investment could create 10,000 new jobs.

tickerNews.title: AKRA reports significant net profit decline to 466 billion rupiah in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo (AKRA) recorded a sharp decline in net profit to 466 billion rupiah (down 31% year‑on‑year, up 14% quarter‑on‑quarter) in 3Q24. This resulted in a 9M24 net profit of only 1.5 trillion rupiah (down 14% YoY), representing just 52% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The weak net profit in 3Q24 was caused by lower revenue and weak margins. • Low recovery in the Trading and Distribution segment: Pre‑tax profit (PBT) of the Trading and Distribution segment, which contributes about 65‑75% of total AKRA PBT, fell 20% YoY over 9M24. The decline was driven by a 5% YoY drop in fuel sales volume due to RKAB permit issues in 1H24 and heavy rainfall at customer mining sites in 3Q24. Weak sales to mining customers, which normally have higher margins than manufacturing or transportation customers, led to a significant margin contraction in the segment. • Sale of 70 ha of JIIPE land in 4Q24 and downgrade of sales guidance: Management revised the 2024 JIIPE land sales guidance down from 115 ha to 100 ha after land sales reached only 32 ha in 9M24, equal to 32% of the new target and 28% of the old target. Previously, in 2Q24 AKRA had revised the guidance from 130 ha to 115 ha. Although JIIPE land sales grew 8% YoY to 32 ha in 9M24, PBT from the Industrial Estate segment fell 15% YoY. Management explained that the PBT decline was due to a fair‑value adjustment on trade receivables because of longer payment terms from clients. • No interim dividend: Management confirmed that there will be no second interim dividend for FY2024. Previously, AKRA paid an interim dividend of IDR 50 per share in August 2024. In FY2023, AKRA paid two interim dividends of IDR 50 per share in August 2023 and IDR 25 per share in November 2023. Key Takeaway: With the weak results, AKRA again lowered its FY2024 net profit guidance from a range of +4‑7% YoY to -14% YoY, or about IDR 2.4 trillion, comparable to FY2022. Consensus is expected to cut AKRA performance estimates further. Over the past three months, consensus has reduced the FY24 net profit estimate by 8% to IDR 2.8 trillion. The net profit decline is expected to lower the FY2024 dividend payout ratio below the FY2023 level of 90%, as AKRA still needs capex for a tank terminal in Morowali and development of the JIIPE industrial zone.

tickerNews.title: BBNI posts net profit of 5.6 trillion rupiah in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) reported a net profit of 5.6 trillion rupiah (up 5% quarter‑on‑quarter, up 3% year‑on‑year) in 3Q24. This resulted in a 9M24 net profit of 16.3 trillion rupiah (up 3.5% YoY), equal to 74% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The result was supported by a decline in provision expenses to 1.8 trillion rupiah (up 8% QoQ, down 19% YoY) in 3Q24, bringing 9M24 provision expenses down to 5.2 trillion rupiah (down 23% YoY). On the top line, Net Interest Income (NII) rose to 10.4 trillion rupiah (up 7% QoQ, down 2% YoY) in 3Q24, while 9M24 NII fell 5.5% YoY to 29.4 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: BSDE records marketing sales of approximately 2 trillion rupiah in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE) recorded marketing sales of about 2 trillion rupiah (up 2.1% YoY, down 23.8% QoQ) in 3Q24. This resulted in 9M24 marketing sales of roughly 6.8 trillion rupiah (up 1.4% YoY), equal to 72% of the 2024 target of 9.5 trillion rupiah. The residential segment contributed 56% of total 9M24 marketing sales, followed by shophouses (23%), apartments (7%), commercial land (6%) and joint‑venture land sales (8%).

tickerNews.title: ASRI reports marketing sales of 1.1 trillion rupiah in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: Alam Sutera Realty (ASRI) recorded marketing sales of 1.1 trillion rupiah (up 95% YoY, up 76% QoQ) in 3Q24. This brought 9M24 marketing sales to 2.3 trillion rupiah (up 48% YoY), equal to 82% of the 2024 target of 2.8 trillion rupiah and surpassing the 2023 marketing sales level of 1.8 trillion rupiah. Company secretary Tony Rudiyanto said the sales were driven by The Gramercy in Alam Sutera, Sutera YMMA (Alam Sutera 2), Agra Cluster in Suvarna Sutera, and several commercial products.

tickerNews.title: BNLI posts net profit of 1.3 trillion rupiah in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: Bank Permata (BNLI) reported a net profit of 1.3 trillion rupiah (up 74% QoQ, up 71% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in a 9M24 net profit of 2.8 trillion rupiah (up 30% YoY). The result was supported by a sharp decline in provision expenses to 147 billion rupiah (down 75% QoQ, down 77% YoY) in 3Q24, bringing 9M24 provision expenses down to 1.2 trillion rupiah (down 36% YoY). On the top line, Net Interest Income (NII) rose to 2.6 trillion rupiah (up 4.4% QoQ, up 3.9% YoY) in 3Q24, leading to a 9M24 NII growth of 2.2% YoY to 7.6 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: BTPS reports net profit of 218.4 billion rupiah in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: Bank BTPN Syariah (BTPS) recorded a net profit of 218.4 billion rupiah (down 24% QoQ, down 13% YoY) in 3Q24. This resulted in a 9M24 net profit of 770.6 billion rupiah (down 23% YoY), equal to 69% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The profit was pressured by a decline in revenue after profit‑sharing distribution to 1.2 trillion rupiah (down 2.5% QoQ, down 11% YoY) in 3Q24, bringing 9M24 profit‑sharing revenue to 3.7 trillion rupiah (down 6.6% YoY). The weakening top line caused operating profit to fall to 277.7 billion rupiah (down 24% QoQ, down 14% YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in 9M24 operating profit of 979.4 billion rupiah (down 24% YoY).

tickerNews.title: HEAL posts net profit of 125 billion rupiah in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) recorded a net profit of 125 billion rupiah (down 14% YoY, down 18% QoQ) in 3Q24. This resulted in a 9M24 net profit of 468 billion rupiah (up 34% YoY), equal to 75% of the FY24 consensus estimate. The Q3 profit decline was mainly due to higher expenses: cost of goods sold rose 14% YoY and operating expenses rose 10% YoY, outpacing revenue growth of 9% YoY. Consequently, the operating profit margin fell to 14.9% in 3Q24 (down from 17.6% in 3Q23 and 17.3% in 2Q24).

tickerNews.title: DRMA reports net profit of 175 billion rupiah in Q3 2024
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal (DRMA) recorded a net profit of 175 billion rupiah (up 1% YoY, up 69% QoQ) in 3Q24. This resulted in a 9M24 net profit of 412 billion rupiah (down 21% YoY). The Q3 performance improved compared with the previous two quarters, with Q3 profit up 1% YoY versus declines of 38% YoY in 1Q24 and 20% YoY in 2Q24. The improvement was driven by higher performance in the two‑wheel segment, which has the highest margin among DRMA's segments, lifting overall margin. Two‑wheel segment revenue grew 19% YoY in 3Q24 (vs. 2% YoY in 1Q24 and 4% YoY in 2Q24).

tickerNews.title: SMDM announces acquisition of 92% stake by BSDE for 2.3 trillion rupiah
tickerNews.content: Suryamas Dutamakmur (SMDM) announced that Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE) has acquired 4.4 billion shares (92% of SMDM) at a price of IDR 531 per share on 23 October 2024. The total transaction value is approximately 2.3 trillion rupiah. After the transaction, BSDE will become the new controlling shareholder of SMDM and will carry out a mandatory tender offer. Previously, in August 2024 BSDE announced that it was negotiating with Top Global Ltd., an entity still affiliated with the Sinar Mas family, to acquire about 92% of SMDM shares.

tickerNews.title: BRMS CEO says no plan to join MSCI index
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Agoes Projosasmito, stated that there is no effort from management to have the company's shares included in the MSCI index. However, he explained that BRMS, through its subsidiary PT Citra Palu Minerals (CPM), is expanding. Bloomberg Technoz reported that Agoes' statement came after market rumors that BRMS could be added to the MSCI index if its share price reaches IDR 400 per share.

tickerNews.title: SIDO declares interim dividend of 540 billion rupiah for FY2024
tickerNews.content: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul (SIDO) will distribute an interim dividend for FY2024 amounting to 540 billion rupiah, or IDR 18 per share. The dividend will be cum‑dividend in the regular market and negotiations on 4 November 2024, with payment on 20 November 2024. Based on SIDO's closing price on Friday 25 October 2024 at IDR 615 per share, the implied dividend yield is 2.9%.

tickerNews.title: EXCL optimistic about merger with Smartfren Telecom
tickerNews.content: The President Director of XL Axiata (EXCL), Dian Siswarini, said that the company is optimistic that the planned merger with Smartfren Telecom will soon receive government approval, allowing the merger to be completed by the end of the year. Previously, EXCL and Smartfren had signed a non‑binding memorandum of understanding to explore a merger in May 2024.

tickerNews.title: ADHI records new contract value of 14.2 trillion rupiah in 9M24
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya (ADHI) recorded new contract value of 14.2 trillion rupiah (down 43% YoY) during 9M24, equal to 38% of the 2024 target of 37.4 trillion rupiah. Funding sources were 54% government, 19% BUMN/BUMD, 18% private sector, and 9% loans. The contracts were dominated (90%) by the engineering and construction segment, followed by property and hospitality (4%), manufacturing (4%), and investment and concessions (2%).

tickerNews.title: PBRX plans debt restructuring to reduce liabilities to $140 million
tickerNews.content: Pan Brothers (PBRX) is circulating a restructuring plan to its creditors for the first time since defaulting on debt in early 2024. Bloomberg reports that PBRX intends to cut its debt from about $325 million to $140 million, a level considered sustainable over the next 15 years. The company also plans to convert its US‑dollar‑denominated bonds and half of its bilateral loans into mandatory conversion bonds (OWK) that will carry no interest. The OWK can be converted into equity after 10 years, with creditors controlling 51% of PBRX shares after conversion. For a syndicated loan of $123 million, PBRX is proposing to extend the maturity to 15 years with an interest rate of only 1% for the first 5‑6 years. Bloomberg notes that the plan may change as the company negotiates with creditors, and management has not commented.

tickerNews.title: SRIL meets delisting criteria after bankruptcy ruling
tickerNews.content: The Director of the Indonesia Stock Exchange, I Gede Nyoman Yetna, said that Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) has met the criteria for delisting after the textile company was declared bankrupt by the Semarang District Court. SRIL's shares have also been suspended for 42 months, making it subject to forced delisting. The exchange has requested SRIL to provide an explanation to the public regarding the company's steps after the bankruptcy ruling.

tickerNews.title: BEER launches new wine product Anggur Nikmat Indonesia
tickerNews.content: Jobubu Jarum Minahasa (BEER) announced the launch of a new product named Anggur Nikmat Indonesia. The wine contains an alcohol content of 19.9%, placing it in the alcoholic beverage category B. Management hopes the product will boost the company's revenue, noting that the total market for alcoholic wine is about 40 times larger than the soju market. Previously, BEER was known for producing Cap Tikus 1978, Daebak Soju, and Daebak Spark.
